The BASF Corporation Chattanooga Site 2 implements these policies through site-specific programs and procedures.


Facility Description

The BASF Corporation Chattanooga Site 2 uses 1,3 Butadiene. This chemical is used to manufacture a water based emulsion polymer or dispersion. This dispersion is used primarily as a binder in carpet backing. The plant also makes products for paper coating and adhesive applications.  


Release Scenarios

Worst Case

7 Vapor cloud explosion resulting from the release of 1,3 butadiene with off-site impacts.    

Alternative

7 Jet fire resulting from the release of 1,3 butadiene with off-site impacts.  


Accidental Release Prevention Program

To prevent accidental releases, this facility is in compliance with the EPA Risk Management Program, the OSHA Process Safety Management standard, and the Chemical Manufacturer Association's Responsible Care Process Safety Code. 


Five Year Accident History

This facility has had no accidental release(s) over the past five years, which meets the reporting criteria.


Emergency Response Program

This facility has an emergency response plan that is coordinated with the community plan.  Hazmat team members are trained and participate in drills regularly.


Planned Changes to Improve Safety

Facility processes are routinely changed to improve safety as a result of employee suggestions, process hazard analyses, incident investigations, etc.

For example, some changes that will be initiated prior to the end of 1999 will improve the safety of our regulated processes and include:

- Installation of remotely actuated isolation valves for all of the 1,3 butadiene storage tanks. 
- Installation of density meters on the drains of 1,3 butadiene storage vessels to

prevent any emissions 
  during the routine draining of water from vessels.
- Installation of additional hydrocarbon detector(s) in the 1,3 butadiene storage area.
- Installation of additional fire proofing insulation on the 1,3 butadiene storage tanks.
- Installation of thermal expansion pots on 1,3 butadiene unloading piping.
- Upgrading of existing process alarm systems in 1,3 butadiene unloading and storage areas.

Commitment to the Community

BASF Corporation has a long tradition of operating its facilities in the safest possible manner.  BASF also believes in being a responsible corporate citizen and maintaining open, constructive dialogue with our neighbors.  These principles are an integral part of our corporate vision statement and values.  We believe that sharing this information with our neighbors makes good sense.  By doing so, we believe the community will better understand how safe and ecologically sound BASF operations are.
